newsitem.title: INDIA: India parliament to hold session on independence.
newsitem.headline: India parliament to hold session on independence.

text.p: The Indian parliament will hold a special four-day session next month as part of the country's celebrations of its 50th anniversary of independence, the speaker of the lower house, P.A. Sangma, said on Wednesday.
United News of India (UNI) quoted Lok Sabha speaker Sangma as saying the session would begin on August 26 and would discuss ways to control population growth.
UNI said parliament would not transact any government business during the special session. The session will not have the customary question hour or zero hour.
India won freedom from Britain on August 15, 1947.
